related.meaning: name of an imperial era (e.g. Heisei, Shōwa)

lessons.japanese: もう年賀状を全部書いてしまったのですか。
lessons.english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

lessons.japanese: 年賀状はもう全部書き上げましたか？
lessons.english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

lessons.japanese: 年賀状はもう全部書き終わった？
lessons.english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

lessons.japanese: 年賀状を書くのは日本の習慣である。
lessons.english: Writing new year's cards is a Japanese institution.

lessons.japanese: 年賀状のおかげで私達は友達や親戚の消息が分かる。
lessons.english: New Year's cards provide us with the opportunity to hear from friends and relatives.

lessons.japanese: 友達に年賀状を出すのを忘れてた。
lessons.english: I forgot to send New Year's cards to my friends.

lessons.japanese: もう年賀状を全部書いてしまったのですか。
lessons.english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

lessons.japanese: 友達に年賀状を出すのを忘れてた。
lessons.english: I forgot to send New Year's cards to my friends.

lessons.japanese: 年賀状のおかげで私達は友達や親戚の消息が分かる。
lessons.english: New Year's cards provide us with the opportunity to hear from friends and relatives.

lessons.japanese: 年賀状を書くのは日本の習慣である。
lessons.english: Writing new year's cards is a Japanese institution.

lessons.japanese: 年賀状はもう全部書き上げましたか？
lessons.english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

lessons.japanese: 年賀状はもう全部書き終わった？
lessons.english: Have you written all the New Year's cards already?

lessons.japanese: 昔は年賀状をプリンターでよく印刷したもんだよ。
lessons.english: I often used to use a printer to make my New Year's cards.

lessons.japanese: 昔は年賀状をプリンターでよく印刷したもんだよ。
lessons.english: I often used to use a printer to make my New Year's cards.
